intro: Draba subcapitata, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm, with basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a single terminal cluster, characteristic of the genus Draba. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude meadows and scree slopes.
